name: The Strand Yangon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fabulous hotel. Classic colonial style. We had stayed at The Raffles in Singapore and The E&O in Penang before and were looking forward to staying here.
reviews.title: Classic hotel
Stay here
reviews.text: Large rooms, wonderful service. Central location convenient to restaurants and markets.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would have been great to have tea and coffee in the room like in most Asian hotels.
reviews.title: Still a classic hotel, but restaurant is below standard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Buffet breakfast would be preferable.
reviews.title: Beautiful classic hotel with excellent service

reviews.text: This is the quintessential British colonial hotel. People will say go to,the governor's residence, which is lovely and in a nicer part of town, bur it misses the experience. The strand is an old style British hotel, with a floor to roof atrium, large rooms and a well trained staff, with floor butlers. The location is it so great and the wifi was lousy, but if you are there as a tourist so what. Go for the experience.
reviews.title: Beautiful place, and no feeling of being in a standard hotel chain...

reviews.text: You don't need to stay the night here to be able to sample an aura of bygone Yangon. I highly recommend the front bar as a perfect place to escape the heat outside or a passing downpour.
reviews.title: Relaxing view of Old Yangon

reviews.text: The ceiling fans & opulent interior are in great contrast to the badly broken pavements outside. The bar accepts US dollars and was empty when I arrived. Beers are $6, Juice $5. Drinks come with complimentary snacks. Staff seeing I was alone - brought over some books of Old Rangoon to read as I drank. I thought this was a great touch. There's also a pool table & at the rear an Art Gallery, plus an extensive Antiques Shop.
reviews.title: Good old time once more!

reviews.text: Myanmar is not known as tourist destination until recently and I did not know what to expect out of this old hotel. After staying for three nights, I must say the hotel still retains all the British colonial charms one would expect! A 24-hour butler service, wooded flooring and stairs to the rooms (beside the lift or elevator), large suite with antique wood furniture, well-stocked lobby bar where cigar smoking is allowed! Just very charming and quaint! Need to book way in advance during the peak tourist months as there are acute shortage of tourist class hotel in the country.
reviews.title: a colonial beauty

reviews.text: I have just spent 2 nights at The Strand hotel and it did not fail in a ways to impress. At one time owned by the same family who ran Raffles in singapore this is at truly lovely hotel.
reviews.title: The Grand Dame of Yangon,but.........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It only has 32... Well let's call the suites because they are all very large. This also means that booking well in advance is a must. We were on the 2nd floor each with its own butler waiting to greet you when you go and come. Nothing is too much for them and they are all very professional.
reviews.title: TOP NOTCH BAR SNACKS

reviews.text: This colonial hotel has been renovated perfectly. Our suite was very pretty and luxury and the butler gave us the perfect service. She even watched our kids so we could drink something in the bar downstairs. The only improvement could be the restaurant service because we got our plates when the cook was ready, so we got all dinner courses at the same time (not relaxed:-)
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.text: Built in 1896 by the Sarkies Brothers, like the Raffles Singapore
reviews.title: I always come back !!!!

reviews.text: It s a luxurious Victorian style Hotel , superbly managed by the present general manager, Mr Didier Belmonte , Spacious rooms and bathrooms , excellent service , amazing food .....the Bar is a must especially on Fridays when everybody in Yangon meet .
reviews.title: Out of a Rudyard Kipling novel in the BEST way

reviews.text: I did try several other hotels during my regular trips to Yangon , and for sure " The Strand" remains my favorite , by far !!
reviews.title: Tranquil amongst Yangons busy neighborhoods

reviews.text: The Strand is by far the nicest place to stay in Yangon. I had no idea what to expect before I arrived in Yangon on business and the moment I walked into the Strand I knew I would have an excellent stay. The rooms are gorgeous and unique and full of history. The common areas are airy and beautiful and the food is excellent. And the staff! I cannot say enough good things about the staff at the Strand. They go above and beyond in every single way. I truly hope to have the chance to visit Myanmar again and I will certainly be staying at the Strand when I do!
reviews.title: Beautiful colonial building

reviews.text: Don’t waste your $ on an executive suite. Night 1 of 3 was in exec suite room 102. BIG room with lots of wasted space and loud music from something down the street. The room is not in as good condition as the 2nd room I stayed in, showing much more wear. Had trouble getting hot water. Complementary bottle of sparkling wine. I was awoken at 6 and 7:30 am by loud music from the street or a car on the street outside. Got the earplugs out to be awoken at 8:00 by music loud enough to breech the earplugs!
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room 2 was 115, a double. Lovely, more charming, better condition, same amenities (with the exception of the wine) and no hot water issues. MUCH quieter on side street across from the embassy. Toilet handle did not always work quite right. I also stayed in 216 on the way home, just as nice (and maybe a little bigger) than 115.
reviews.title: The bar visit could have been excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Towels are enormous bath sheets (too big for a hair wrap). Good linens on bed. Beds comfortable enough. Plenty of bottled water. Minibar. Coffee and tea-making set (check the sugar before you use it… there was a bug in the sugar in 102). Complementary bottled water. Hairdryer in room. Wifi occasionally had issues, but worked much better than I was expecting for Myanmar. Nice and clean. Breakfast service was prompt enough. Americans will need to bring an electrical adapter (3 squared prongs). Late checkouts not accepted.
reviews.title: Best in Yangon

reviews.text: We decided to go to the Strand Bar for our last night in Myanmar after a two week holiday. We arrived at 5pm on Friday night to find only 4 other guests. Service was a bit slow, but the drinks signature cocktails were very nice. The Strand signature cocktails are heavily based on Mandalay Rum. The bar got busier and busier through the night since it was happy hour and half price drinks. But that made the beer normally priced at $6 just about bearable. I was amazed that they claimed that they didn't take credit cards. Although credit cards are relatively new to Myanmar, but quite a few hotels now accept them. When I asked for the bill they had added a 10% tip and a 5% government tax as stated on the drinks list. However I was very angry that when I paid the bill in dollars I was short changed. When I found the waiter again he said that it was hotel policy to round up the total of the bill. I stated that they had already been tipped and I would like my change, but he stated that they didn't keep small notes. After I stated that I wanted my change the money was finally handed over. The people of Myanmar are wonderful, friendly and possibly the most giving and kindest that I have ever had the privilege of meeting. The bar staff in the Strand should remind themselves of what the rest of their nation are like. This left a bad taste in my mouth after a wonderful trip to Myanmar.
reviews.title: Conviviality in The Strand Bar
Colonial Burma at its best
reviews.text: Spending two days at The Strand, a former British Hotel built in 1901. Very large rooms with King bed, living room, vast bathroom, desk area with 15 to 18 foot ceilings. Full service facility with butler service.

description: A three-story Victorian-style, The Strand is located in the heart of the city. Its colonial charm is apparent from the rattan furniture to the chandeliers and the black-lacquered ceiling fans. Each of its airy suites combines the resplendence of a bygone era with all the modern conveniences.
